wikipedia_page.main:
Frank Albert Harris (19 March 1907 – 21 February 1936) was an English cricketer.  Harris was a right-handed batsman, but his bowling style is unknown. He was born in Bristol.
Harris made his first-class debut for Gloucestershire against Warwickshire in the 1929 County Championship.  He made 9 further first-class appearances, the last of which came against Lancashire in the 1931 County Championship.  In his 10 first-class matches he batted without success, scoring 68 runs at an average of 5.66, with a high score of 33.He died in Bristol on 21 February 1936.
